meanings.definition: relating to or characteristic of an earlier period
meanings.sent1: The ancient artifacts had an archaical design.
meanings.sent2: The historian studied the archaical customs of the ancient civilization.
meanings.sent3: The archeologist found an archaical tool that looked like a relic from a bygone era.
meanings.sent4: Her archaical dress sense was like stepping back in time.
meanings.sent5: The archaical architecture of the castle was breathtaking.

meanings.sent1: His archaical flip phone was a novelty in the modern world.
meanings.sent2: The archaical technology was no match for the new advancements.
meanings.sent3: She wore an archaical hat that made her look like a character from a vintage movie.
meanings.sent4: The archaical car sputtered along the road, drawing curious glances.
meanings.sent5: The archaical language used in the play added a touch of nostalgia.
